intro: Corybas viridisepalus, commonly known as the green-sepal corymb, is a member of the兰科 (Orchidaceae) family. It is characterized by its unique, spurred flower structure and vibrant green sepals. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The flowers are typically small and occur in clusters, often with a distinct coloration that aids in pollination. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
